plot: The Big Three come to new understandings about life.

It's the day of Rebecca's funeral, and the Big Three are not only preparing for the ceremony itself but muse about what their life will be like without Rebecca, who has long been their guiding force, Kate in particular, who has finally come into her own, fears them losing their way, not only as individuals but as a family. Meanwhile, what Rebecca feared the most in her progressive degeneration was not losing memory of the big events but of the everyday events. As such, one specific day is shown when the family had nothing to do and how they filled that day, which would, like many such days, have profound effects on them all in subtle ways.—Huggo
